result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan M Smerling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

ADDRESS INFO for Jordan M Smerling
Current: 571 Cty Rd A, c/o Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 05-06-2016)
Prior: 110 Oak Ln, Glenwood Springs, CO 81601 United States

10:34 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea Guilty to Count 2 on 2015CM242, count 1 on 2015CM165 and Count 1 on 2015CM158, with jail and costs.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2 on 2015CM242 as charged and orders the balance of the counts be dismissed, finds the defendant guilty on count 1 on 2015CM165  as charged & count 1 on 2015CM158 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2015CM242

-30 days county jail.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Rest - $19.88.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

2015CM165

-10 days county jail, consecutive to any other sentence
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

2015CM158

-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court grants huber and grants 60 days to commence sentence.

Court adjourned at 10:44 a.m.
Notice of Hearing for Plea & Sentencing scheduled on 05/03/2016 at 10:30 a.m. has been returned.  Return to sender.  Attemped, not known.  Unable to Forward.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond.  Court will set both cases for Plea & Sentencing on November 24, 2015 at 11:00 a.m .
